description: Document the public and governmental sustainability reporting mechanisms. Identify relevant sustainability metrics, reporting, targets, and policies that not only reduce resource usage for the government customer, but also across the sector and nationally. Encourage the organization to consider public sustainability performance reporting in their forward planning for the service.
title: Document governmental sustainability reporting mechanisms
title_full: GOV13-BP01 Document governmental sustainability reporting mechanisms

description: Minimize duplication of computing power where possible. Leverage and enable reusable environments, patterns, and marketplaces as a way to minimize duplication of computing power. Encourage the organization to minimize computing power where possible in the service by utilizing shared infrastructure and avoiding redundant workloads.
title: Minimize duplication of computing power
title_full: GOV13-BP02 Minimize duplication of computing power

description: Share best sustainability practice across the jurisdiction or sector. Use cross-agency, cross-jurisdiction, and cross-sector collaboration to identify and learn from examples of similar problems in other areas. Encourage the organization to engage with jurisdictional sustainability best practice throughout the delivery of the service.
title: Share sustainability best practices across jurisdictions
title_full: GOV13-BP03 Share sustainability best practices across jurisdictions

description: Identify sharable data where appropriate, internal and external. Sharing data proactively can reduce system inefficiencies. Explore the data, APIs, and tools that could be leveraged by other government departments, the broader economy, and the community to spur the scaling of digital government applications. Support the organization to include data, insights, or both in the architectural design.
title: Identify and share data to reduce system inefficiencies
title_full: GOV13-BP04 Identify and share data to reduce system inefficiencies

description: Identify sustainability policies relevant to the organization. Identify any sustainable procurement guidelines or policies that a jurisdiction might have to adopt, such as the Green Public Procurement in the EU. Encourage the organization to understand and adopt relevant sustainability policies in the design, delivery, and management of the service.
title: Identify and adopt relevant sustainability policies
title_full: GOV13-BP05 Identify and adopt relevant sustainability policies

description: Identify and design or deliver inclusively of jurisdictional sustainability goals. Verify that national sustainability goals and reporting are built in from the beginning, or have a funded plan to have them created over time. Identify if broader sustainability goals are relevant to the service and how they can be incorporated into the design.
title: Design inclusively of jurisdictional sustainability goals
title_full: GOV14-BP01 Design inclusively of jurisdictional sustainability goals

description: Leverage contextual design methods, like life journey based service design. Take a more holistic view using modes, such as life events or user journeys, to produce an improved customer experience as well as better sustainability outcomes by reducing duplication and consolidating services. Identify the end user context or journey as a means to identifying opportunities to consolidate or reduce duplication of resourcing.
title: Use life journey based service design to reduce duplication
title_full: GOV14-BP02 Use life journey based service design to reduce duplication

description: Minimize physical impact of services, such as printing. Design services so that they can be completed entirely digitally by reducing the need for printing documents, such as eliminating the need for physical signatures or documents. Use end-to-end service design to minimize physical printing and environmental impacts of the service.
title: Minimize physical impact of services
title_full: GOV14-BP03 Minimize physical impact of services

description: Leverage automation and virtualization where possible. Explore the opportunity to deploy digital technologies by rethinking existing processes that might improve operational efficiencies, for example, using smart technologies to manage built environments. Plan around maximum virtualization of services and where components might be made available as a utility for ease of reuse.
title: Leverage automation and virtualization for efficiency
title_full: GOV15-BP01 Leverage automation and virtualization for efficiency

description: Leverage low energy sensor technologies for early detection and modelling opportunities. Leverage new technologies, such as IoT, digital twins, and AI analysis and modelling to support more sustainable systems, decision making, and services. Support the organization to identify opportunities to leverage sensor and modelling technologies in the service, where appropriate.
title: Leverage IoT and digital twins for sustainable decision making
title_full: GOV15-BP02 Leverage IoT and digital twins for sustainable decision making
